TopicTitle: modded KSP install wont load (possibly due to replacing graphics driver)

Articles.Content:
2 days ago, I replaced my computers graphics driver as I've read that it could improve performance while gaming. After that I ran my modded KSP install which was being laggier than usual. The next time I tried to play that install It wouldn't load at all. So I removed the new graphics driver and replaced it with the old one, and it still didn't work. Please help.

original graphics driver:

Intel v15.22.8.64.2462 (2011/08/31)

new:

Intel HD Graphics Driver v15.28.22.64.34

Intel Chipset Device Device v 10.013 was also installed

system specs:

OS: Windows 7 Home Premium (64 bit)

Ram: 4 gigabytes (3.75 gigabytes usable)

KSP Version: 0.90.0 (32 bit)

(via Windows start task manager)

stock KSP:

CPU: 80% (46% average)

RAM: 2.21 GB

Time: 2 minutes, 34 seconds

modded KSP (at hang up/crash):

CPU: 100%

RAM: 2.48 GB

Time: 35 seconds

(all mods are current)

Toolbar

Active Texture Management

Aerojet Kerbodyne

BahaSP (plugin only)

Boulder Co (active texture management configs)

Cacteye (slim probe core only)

CMES (large balka solar panel only)

CSS (loading stops here at: CSS/ Parts/CSSWings/Names/Columbia1)

DMagic Orbital Science

FASA

Firespitter

FTMN

Hull Camera

ISS Community (MPLM, Unity node 1, PMA, CBM, and Radiator only)

JSI

Klockheed Martian

Klockheed Martin Special

KSO (Space Station Parts (pack 2) only)

NearFuture Props

PlanetShine

Procedural Fairings

ProceduralParts

R&S Capsuledyne

RLA Stockalike (SRB's only)

RN_US_Probes

SmokeScreen

Station Parts Expansion

Tantares

TantaresLV

Trigger Tech (Kerbal alarm clock)

Virgin Kalactic

ModuleManager (2.5.6)

output log

dxdiag

Edited January 19, 2015 by gooddog15
output log & dxdiag
The logs might say why Gooddog15, and your dxdiag as well

forgot about that.....

log now up along with dxdiag

found a Null Reference Exception while loading:

Edited January 18, 2015 by gooddog15
I redownloaded all the mods and installed them as precaution, and it worked.
